capsules_submitted.utterance: So I've been told that the wood is actually made from a male tree. That's interesting, I confirm it's true.

You know, I was talking to someone the other day and they mentioned that wood is typically considered a masculine material. I think it's because of its strength and durability - it's often associated with traditional woodworking and carpentry, which are traditionally male-dominated fields. But at the same time, I've also seen some beautiful wooden furniture designed by female artists, so I'm not sure if it's really tied to one gender or the other.
